div.pre: 2217 Noto environs, 24 km. SW of Syra- (744 = 1029) cuse, 1853 Burial: 250-200 B.C. (K) Contents: c. 700 AR Philistis: c. 600 Gelon II: c. 100 Ptolemaic ? Disposition: dispersed Riccio, BullInst 1854, p. xlii Romano, Sopra alcune monete scoverte in Sicilia (Paris, 1862), p. 52 Salinas, PerNumSfrag 1868, pp. 206-7 The location is reported by Romano, the numbers by Riccio. Noe 1029 (Syra- cuse 1853) is presumably the same hd.; Salinas, the only authority cited for it, in fact gives the location as "nella provincia di Siracusa."
